panels.description: Shows the total number of artifacts stored in all repositories.
panels.title: Artifacts Count

panels.description:
Shows the total size of all artifacts stored in Artifactory.

Note: The information about storage is updated infrequently (once in 6 hours), so the number that you see here is just an approximation.
panels.title: Total Artifacts Size

panels.description: Shows the total number of binaries stored in Artifactory (data from the last checkpoint).
panels.title: Total Number of Binaries

panels.description: Shows the total number of bytes used by Artifactory storage (information is from the last checkpoint)
panels.title: Total Used Storage

panels.description: Shows the total size of all artifacts in the trash
panels.title: Total Trash Size

panels.description: The uptime of the JVM - pod $pod
panels.title: Uptime - $pod

panels.description: Shows the total number of repositories in Artifactory
panels.title: Repositories

panels.description: Shows the total number of package types that are used in repositories of all customers
panels.title: Package Types

panels.description: Shows the total number of federated repositories in the selected JPD
panels.title: Federated Repositories

targets.expr: sum(system_cpu_usage{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod) + sum(process_cpu_usage{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod)

panels.description: The memory utilization ratio: Displays the ratio of used /committed JVM memory to the maximum available JVM memory

links.title: View more application metrics for this pod

targets.expr:
sum(jvm_memory_used_bytes{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod)
/
sum(jvm_memory_max_bytes{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod)

sum(jvm_memory_committed_bytes{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod)
/
sum(jvm_memory_max_bytes{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory"}) by (pod)

panels.title: JVM Memory Usage (% of Max Memory)

panels.description:
The number of threads in various states within the JVM.

Thread States:

- **RUNNABLE**: Threads that are actively executing Java code.
- **BLOCKED**: Threads that are waiting to acquire a monitor lock to enter a synchronized block or method.
- **WAITING**: Threads that are waiting indefinitely for another thread to notify or interrupt them.
- **TIMED_WAITING**: Threads that are waiting for a specific period, such as through a Thread.sleep() or similar operation.
- **TERMINATED**: Threads that have completed their execution and terminated.
panels.title: JVM - Threads By State

panels.description:
The amount of memory that JVM uses:

- **Committed Memory** is the amount of memory that JVM allocated from the operating system
- **Used Memory** is the amount of memory that JVM actually uses
- **Max Memory** is the maximal amount of memory available to JVM
panels.title: JVM Memory Usage (Bytes)

panels.description:
- **Busy Threads** -  The current number of threads in Tomcat's thread pool that are actively processing requests.
- **Idle Threads** - The current number of threads in Tomcat's thread pool that are waiting for incoming requests.
- **Max Threads** - The maximum number of threads configured for Tomcat's thread pool.

targets.expr: max(tomcat_threads_busy_threads{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory", name=~"$tomcat_app"}) by (name, pod)
max(tomcat_threads_config_max_threads{application="Artifactory", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="artifactory", name=~"$tomcat_app"}) by (name, pod)

panels.title: Tomcat - Threads ($tomcat_app)
DB Queries Rate (queries / minute) - Per Pod

panels.description: This graph lists queries that we suspect to be a source of a significant load on DB.
panels.title: Intensive DB Queries - Wait Time / second

panels.description: This graph lists Artifactory activities that spend "too much" time, waiting for DB queries.
panels.title: DB-Intensive Artifactory Activities
Scheduled Jobs with High Work Time (> 10% of thread time)
Work Queues with High Work Time (> 10% of thread time)

list.description: The minimal step (time period) used to aggregate the data for.  Using periods shorter than 75 seconds often causes Prometheus to bring no data at all.
list.label: Granularity
list.name: min_step

list.description: The list of K8S namespaces, limited to 1000 values.
list.label: namespace
list.name: namespace
